website_summaries.verdict: An ultra-compact powerhouse of a projector. A great choice for a backyard movie night.
pros: If size is your primary concern, this is your best option
Packs a punch and comes at a reasonable price
Includes HDMI, USB, and MicroSD ports
Displays up to a 2.5 metre screen in 720p quality
cons: Though advertised as 1080p video, the max resolution is 720p

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Kodak Ultra Mini Portable Projector for projecting photos on to my table so I can trace and see each and every color. I do this with the help of a tripod (make sure tripod has right size mounting screw) which has two screw sizes. I don't need a very dark room, but the darker the better to see the picture. The main reason I purchased this mini projector is because it projects a very small picture which I can trace onto watercolor paper, most of the other mini projectors can't go down that small. Happy with this purchase and I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LIMITED CONTINUOUS USE
customer_reviews.text: Love the compactness. Had to obtain a different cord attachment than what was included in the kit. The projector went completely blank and would not restart after 10 minutes of use. We were projecting a powerpoint program of approximately 25 slides. Would not recommend this product for presentations or any video content over a specific time frame. Seems to heat up and close down on a whim.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: It is okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love its shape, color, size and its light weight. There are a few problems. When the room is not really dark, the images is not clear or invisible. Even when it is completely dark, the images are darker than what my other projectors can make. It needs an adopter to be connected with iPhone7. It can be connected with my MacBook Pro using the HDMI cable that came with it, but it requires some setting on Mac side instead of just connecting. However, I still like it. I think it is pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Epo

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Be realistic in your expectations and you’ll be pleased. This is not some $5000 4K projector it is a pocket sized projector. For me it does exactly what I wanted / expected. It attaches quickly and easily to my laptop, allows me to do on the fly presentations, and the battery holds up pretty well. I have used it several times already and have no complaints. Just have a realistic expectation and know what you are buying.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: NOT for gaming
customer_reviews.text: The description says "immersive gaming" and even mentions using with an Xbox. Well if you plug this into your Xbox you will not get the advertised 1080p picture quality, you will be stuck at 720p. In fact I think the only way to get the 1080p quality is by using this with a PC and forcing the secondary display resolution to be 1080p. So the 1080p advertising should reschedule qualify that it's limited situations. Otherwise it's bright enough if you're in a dark room and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Vikse

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised! 1080p is a joke!
customer_reviews.text: Product NOT as advertised. The description says 1080p Projector. It's not full HD, it's not even HD ready! The image is a measly 640x320 pixel,s which is less than old school CRTs! False advertising! Should be removed from sale or description changed! Not just misleading but a flat out lie!

My laptop does not have a HDMI port. I wish this had been clear before I purchased it. I would not have bought it otherwise. Sad to return but it does not fit my purposes.

The projector does not warn you when it is about to die so I’ve been mid-drawing when it shut off. I may need to keep it plugged in when I’m using it...but I dont need to move it/travel with it so that’s not an issue for me

I used to use a slide projector for this work but have "teched" up and bought a Kodak Scanza to convert slides to .jpg's and then put them on a thumb drive to use on this projector. So Far - so good!
